summary: The Silent Generation, born between 1928 and 1945, is a smaller demographic group compared to the generation that followed, the Baby Boomers. This generation experienced significant historical events like the Great Depression and World War II, which impacted their upbringing. They are known for their traditional values and conformity but also played a role in the civil rights movement and 1960s counterculture. In the UK and other countries, similar generations emerged with comparable characteristics, influenced by the challenges of the mid-20th century.
title: Silent Generation
